one_reviews_text: Great game. My problem is the Oculus Store version is VR only.  Steam version allows both options. Sometimes I just wanna throw it up on the big screen and can’t do that.  Awesome rally game! but don’t buy from here!

Outside of Halflife: Alyx this is the best game on Oculus. The immersive graphics and realistic game play are without comparison. Playing it over the past year or so there have been bugs but I tolerate them for the gameplay because it's that good.

How ever the golden 1% of the time the keyboard will allow you to get to settings to setup your steering wheel and the peddles will work but the steering wheel will not. I find this game disapointing on the Quest 2 headset. It's like there is no improvement from Dirt 1 ... and like I have a CV1 , not a Quest 2 . Normally , Rift S games run very well on Quest 2 but this one has poor graphics . I'll try to upscale with Oculus Portal Resolution but ... driving in a cockpit without any other choice and cams ... ... is not convincing cause the resolution is very blurry for the outside... which is what I want to see better normally . 

Not impressed. Won't ask a refund but may ask a core to play in 2d via Steam cause sincerely .... it's not good on the eyes. It's like playing a really old pc game in as low as 800x600px resolution or 1280x720 px. I'd like a view without the dash so we can at least put all the headset's resolution on the outside, not the cockpit. I know it may feel strange to look around in this kind of view but I'd prefer that than to loose all the scenery quality. 

I see super good what's in my car but I don't see good what's the more important in the game , the road .

Not sure what to tell you , I think I may regret I have bought this game but I did it while it was in promotion and may play it in the future if it updates a bit cause it's supporting Link but ... not convincing on the eyes . The feeling would be good if all the scenery outside didn't look all ... blurry and.... really low res.

one_reviews_text: 55 euro for a game with no sound.total garbage.

I bought it from steam and switch to oculus version.  Some say they are the same now, but it's definitely not.  Oculus version is way way better than steam version.  First, steam version has weird flat screen ratio so all the HUD signs are squized, almost unreadable, but oculus verstion has no problem with ratio.  Second, it seems to use less resources of CPU & GPU so frame rate is more stable.  Just with these two things, it gives much better experiences.  

Down side is....  it's way more expensive, no DLC yet.  Force feedback and vibration is much less than steam version so it needs to be adjusted about 140%.  Sound level is also a bit low (about 70% compared to steam version).  

I guess basically Steam and Oculus version are the same game.  But for VR, Oculus version is way better, much more stable.

Excellent game looks and plays great if you have The pc to run it +  wheel & pedals buy it !
i think most if not all the DLC since release has been added for free
only reason this is not 5 stars is, in some cars when you recenter your view in hmd your head is 3-4 " behind your neck, so you have to slide  forward ,basically line your neck up with the view instead of the other way round
sort it CODEMASTERS !   other than that great game BUY IT !

Rift S i9 9900k 32 gb ram Gtx 1080 runs excellent on high with some ultra settings
no sound problems and keep the flat screen version pancake is dead !
Waste of money in 2020

I never had any technical problem with the game, apart from that the most of the updates needs additional >100GB of disk space in order to install them, and it keeps awfully long also on SSD.
The picture is clear, but i need to use Oculus Tray Tool to adjust supersampling to the desired level (1.4 on GTX 1070). The game runs exceptionally smooth, the frametime is a way more linear than in any other racing games i've tried. You can run this version also on display with the -novr switch.

The only downside of this game is the FFB, it's so empty sometimes, which corrupts the game VR immersion. I've tried many settings, but it's basically too simple, it seems many force effect are missing from the math. If you don't know what i mean try Assetto Corsa Competizione, and you will understand.

Apart from the FFB this game is so good! Flying on the Finalnd stages or slipping in Monte Carlo is totally awsome! I grinned at every turn. If you like rallying its a must try.

review_title: No sound after latest update on Rift S
one_reviews_text: Was loving this game and ran like a dream until the latest game update, now I've got no sound at all, all other games are OK, tried removing and reinstalling and lost weeks of progress and still no sound, very unhappy, give me back audio.

I tried really hard to fix the game  and i uninstalled it then reinstalled it. i looked at my drivers for sound and they all updated . lots of people have this ishue to and i sugest not buying unless you want to have no sound .

Check Codemasters forums as of late, the server seems to be spotty and your progress can either disappear, not being available or not getting connected at all. If the game works, is a nice experience but, beware of their side being short serviced.

Codemasters should be ashamed of themselves as this has to be one of the most shambolic releases of 2019

review_title: What's here is good but not complete
one_reviews_text:
This is pretty much a demo version of Dirt 2.  It doesn't have all the cars or all the tracks you would get by buying pretty much any other version of the game.

Other versions have special events, but not this one.

The quality of what is here is top notch, but there are a lot more tracks and cars with any other version.  Now that the other versions have full SDK support there is no reason to get this one.

I’ve never had any issues with any other VR game but this one really tried my patience.  Just could not get it to recognise my keyboard or steering wheel reliably then when it did start there was no audio.  This was resolved by (would you believe it) adding the game to the Steam Library and starting it from there!  I found this fix online so I’m not the only one having these issues with the Oculus version. 
The game itself is pretty good IF you can get it working.

review_title: Way better than the Steam version!
one_reviews_text: Quite a few negative reviews. Not sure what people were expecting but I 'm very happy to run high gfx settings and run smoothly in VR. A few minutes spent dialing in my DD wheel and it feels great. Not so worried about DLC yet - just enjoying having a rally sim in VR for now. Look forward to more developments. [got mine at the sale price btw :)]

Update:  This game is an amazing experience when it works.  Right now, I'm getting a "failed to load player profile" retry or cancel.  Both options take me back to the intial screen.  I can't play it.
Sometimes the wheel works... sometimes it doesn't.  It's just not worth the hassle.  It's problematic even when it works... but when it does... OMG it's fun!
I still want my money back.

review_title: No sound like for many others
one_reviews_text:
I usually hate when people add reviews based on trouble with their hardware and not the actual game, but I was just about to give this one star because of the sound issue.

Thanks to another reviewer I tried adding the game in the Steam library and started it from there and the sound worked when doing that. The game looks better than Dirt Rally. Played on ultra settings (GTX 1080 Ti) and it looks and plays great.

It's a joke that there is no DLC in the oculus version, whereas the Steam version is always half the price and has all the DLC available. Like seriously, how is that okay? The game runs well but the fact that we get shafted makes this a 1 star.

Wow. What a game .codemasters have done an amazing conversation to oculus rift. I'm running with a  gtx1060 .i7 7700. I'm running the setting on low to medium with the shaders set high. And it look and plays amazing .I'm using the rift s . And it runs brilliantly. Plus with all the DLC.you basically have dirt rally 1 and 2 .all rolled into one game . Highly recommended.
I want to enjoy it, but audio isn't working, if i get it to work then I'll update my review. Don't have this problem with any other titles and quick google search shows that I'm not alone.

Since update v1.9 with native Oculus Support in the Steam Version, there is no need to buy the Oculus-Version anymore. I read in the forum, that it runs great now.
This Version does not contain any DLCs like the Steam-Version offers. Well, the content has been installed, but it's STILL not available ingame.

Great game, love it , runs surprisingly well on my old toaster, if you have played DiRT Rally and liked it , you will love this game, it's a definite improvement in physics and graphics, DR2 retains the feel and atmosphere of the first game, but DR2 feels more accurate in it's simulation of Rallying. 

I'll probably update this review with system specs etc .. but so far so good, if you meet Oculus system requirements for VR , you'll have no problems running the game.

I have been a fan of the Dirt franchise for many years. When I found out DR 2.0 was going to have VR, I immediately bought it... from Steam. The SteamVR experience in DR 2.0 is AWFUL. It was brought to my attention that the Oculus version was great. And I bought it. And it was great. Now I have two full priced versions of the same game. And no one will refund me for the initial purchase. I am not happy. Extremely not happy. Also, there is now a question as to whether or not DR 2.0's DLC will even be featured on Oculus? This is offensive. This is the kind of money-grubbing activity that, before now, was relegated to the likes of EA. This is what can only be referred to as an amoral and indecent cash grab. Shame on you, Oculus/Facebook. Shame on you, Zuckerberg.

I bought this on Steam and it works badly in VR, just because Oculus team developed Vr SDK only for Oculus version! So I have to buy again this on Oculus Store. Don't mind the quality of the game, it's a scam to customers. Don't mind about how Oculus and Steam partnership, blame on both vendor. Such a shame and 54$ spent to have a workingcopy of the game!

Awesome. Just unbelievable what they have done with this game.  Graphics are improved on every level.  Must buy if you have a Rift S.  For a preview on th game watch my channel on YouTube called Gaming in still Life
https://youtu.be/C5gRPAhcsHs
Don't get this until it's fixed

This is an amazing rally experience, but suffers from poor coding on Codemasters behalf; the game freezes slightly every few seconds, which totally breaks immersion. Luckily this can be overcome by removing all attached USB devices, with the exception of my Thrustmaster wheel (I had to remove my HOTAS and wireless keyboard/mouse). After that, the game ran flawlessly. I wish I had tried this when I was running the Steam version, as I assumed that it was another Oculus game that ran poorly on Steam. 
As for the game, I love it! Be aware though, it is an extremely challenging game to play. Between DR2, and Project Cars 2, my VR racing experience is covered. 
I would have given the game five stars, but the aforementioned stuttering glitch lowers the score.
This was a scam to take your money for exclusiveness on the Oculus Store, as soon as they took the money they let CodeMasters release Oculus suport on steam. WOW

review_title: I already own this game on steam
one_reviews_text: This VR implementation is OK but its no where near as good as dirt 1. The graphics are pretty crappy and it seems like its not optimized for VR at all. Why did I have to pay for the game twice to get such a lousy VR implementation?

When it works it works, but I should have waited for a sale day
As I have said, for a vr rally experience, My go to is still DirtRallyVR. My apologies for being so negative, but I was so looking forward to this even at $A90,  but my advice is now wait for the sales and in the mean time explore some of the alternatiives

TY codemaster for VR BUT the version on steam bought previously does not support oculus .... really i paid 59 euros for the deluxe ....Very badly .. I reluctantly bought that of oculus, play great but another 54 euros, and the audio (win 10) does not go in any way, nor the mouse !!! na na na na na
I hope they fix it as soon as possible .... 
edit
I have fix it by start the game from steam..

Gameplay & Performance // Oculus Rift S // GTX 1060 (6GB)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dyiVbknx0-E
(Please Note: Links might not work from Oculus so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Dirt Rally 2')

**IMPORTANT / PLEASE NOTE: I think the camera resetting (As mentioned in my Video and this Review) is a fault with the NEW Oculus BETA CLIENT, I had the same issue in 'Dirt Rally 1' and 'Until You Fall' - People say its a fault with Oculus. I am looking into it.


The game defaults to the lowest settings on GTX 1060 (6GB) and its playable on 'Ultra Low' and 'low' settings if you just want to race and don't mind all the graphic fedelity. The game does look more blurry on the lowest settings and I did get some graphic improvements tweaking textures, shaders etc, but the frame rate was good.
I think the game will slowly be optimised over the coming months so you might be able to tweak the graphics even more.
I did play around with all graphic settings and the game looked amazing on Ultra, but you will probably need a 1070 or higher to appreciate these settings. (as stated in the games specs sheet)
If you have a 1060, I would probably say give the 1st 'DiRT Rally' game a go first, you'll get a very similar experience.
This game feels more of the same on a lower end card, and you really do need a beefy card to benefit what 'DiRT Rally 2' has to offer.
My only real complaints was the camera jumping to the side of the vehicle randomly throughout the game which you can see in my video.
These jumps happened more frequently the higher the settings, which suggest either my 1060 trying to cope, or a fault/error with my Rift S tracking.
(I'll need to look into this more)

UPDATE 8/12/2019  Have figured out workaround for getting full sound. Game is now quite nice to drive and rather fun. Rating has been updated.

BTW, it's time that CM learns about the new-fangled device for a PC called a MOUSE! Please start including mouse support in your games. review_title: Great game - one staring due to price
one_reviews_text: Like many other here have said, I also picked this up on Steam VR assuming it would run fine on my Rift-S and 1080ti (like DiRT 1.0 does), to then find out the Oculus SDK (optimised) version is only available through the Oculus store at £44.99 which you can only play in VR mode (no 2D desktop mode in this version!). Compare this to the steam price which is on sale today at £17.99 and not only that, the Steam version offers both VR and 2D mode games. Very bad business practice by Facebook and/or Codemasters.  Even if you love the game, it's got to be one star at that price.

HUGE difference in performance.  It's a real shame you're making us buy the game twice in order to play it in VR.  I really hope you'll throw in all the DLC for free for all of us who've already spent over $100 on the crap Steam version.  It's almost unplayable on Steam, and plays smooth as silk in the Oculus version.

I just don't get it, none of the menus work, should i be able to access 'Free Play' , VR comfort etc, they are blanked off, i can't adjust in game FF, i'm running  gears in auto apparently without an option to change to manual, there's mouse support for some parts of the menu but not others ? i can play career and special events assuming you havce accrued enough points to purchase relevant vehicles, It's a cut down version for Oculus? All seems an incredible mess to me

I tried a lot of driving simulators in VR. I can't switch back to a flat screen now when it comes to driving. The thing is, dirt rally 1 was a great title. But it was poorly optimised. Dirt Rally 2.0 works with all the graphics settings set to ultra, and still have 30% headroom for supersampling (2080ti). On my 1080ti, all the settings were set to medium, solid 80fps on the rift S. This helps a lot in immersing yourself behind the wheel, and just enjoy driving. I will not try to compare handling, and other aspects of the game, because that is different with every person. One thing we all have in common in VR is graphics, and how the game performs. In my opinion, dirt rally 2.0 nailed it!

Upgraded to 4 stars. The game is terriffic however it's missing much of the DLC from the Steam version. Hope we won't have to pay for it seeing as at the time of this review the Steam version and all DLC is 50% off. I also think we need the option to play in non VR mode. I have all graphics settings maxed out but every now and then, I get the occational stutters. Overall I love it and cant wait for more DLC!!
crashes...does not work

review_title: A Must For Dirt Rally 1.0 Fans
one_reviews_text:
As of this review i have played 2+ hours of the game testing different cars in most countries.

GTX 1080
32GB DDR4 3200mhz
i7-7700k 4.8Ghz
Rift CV1
Mix of Medium/Low settings 90fps with a slight stutter every few seconds (even if i'm stopped and looking straight ahead it dips to 70fps and back to 90)  I'm sure some tweaks will help.  (I'll update this when i have more time put in)

Pros:  Sense of speed, cars feel much heavier and grounded.  Physics feel pretty solid too.  Can place the car where you want it a lot easier now when going sideways.  Driver now rotates the wheel more than 360 degrees so his movements will now match your wheel rotation unlike Dirt 1.0
Easily accessable for new players.  Pacenotes seem pretty spot on so far.  T300RS wheel and custom Ebrake and shifter all recognized and easily bindable (nice work)

Cons: The price if you're mainly purchasing for rally is a bit high.  Stages are the usual , 1 or 2 long stages broken into multiple stages and ran forward and reverse.   Lack of WRC cars (personal preference)  
From what i can see and i'll edit if wrong, replays are projected on a screen in front of you instead of being fully VR.  

All in all, a nice step up from Dirt Rally.  Can't wait till the DLC arrives to the Oculus version so that we can enjoy some stages i absolutely loved with a new physics overhaul

Playing this in VR is amazing, incredibly immersive! I'm a huge fan of racing sims and this is by far my favourite! This is the kind of thing VR is made for.

SOUND FIX
A fix for anyone else having a problem with no sound in game is to disable all other audio devices except the one you want to use. Bit annoying but only takes a second and is well worth it.

An issue I have is you can't use the steering wheel to navigate the menus, neither the mouse. so you have to use the arrow keys on keyboard to navigate which can be awkward, especially when you have to find your ESC key with the VR headset on! Same issue with the non vr version though

Dirt 2 is a real improvement over Dirt 1 in presentation, graphics, ease of use, and gameplay.  I like the new stages more than the old ones.  I like all of the improvements and I'm glad that they finally released it onto the Oculus Store.
Update: I upgraded my score from 3 to 5 as I found out that the DLC will become available on the Oculus store in the future.

Dirt rally 2.0 does almost everything right. Especially when it comes to driving. Physics and handling are very good. Imo even better than Dirt rally 1 which i have played dozens of hours.

 Cars have more weight in them and you can feel the grip or when losing it. 

There are also some not so good things like bad force feedback (tested on g920) and lack of information of different options and what they do.

Game also runs playable with 1060 6gb. Preset low and anisotropic x16.

review_title: Great rally game, improved over DiRT 1
one_reviews_text:
DiRT 1.0 is easily my most played VR title, tracking into hundreds of hours played. So my expectiations were high for the successor, and Codemasters managed to deliver! This is easily the best rally game out there, surpassing both the original DiRT as well as Richard Burns Rally.

Dont let negative comments in forums regarding force feedback and graphics fool you (as they did me, while waiting for the VR version). Everything worked fine straight out of the box. Device management is well done this time, and graphics work wonderfully on mid settings on a Geforce 1080 (non-Ti) with a Rift CV1. Force feedback is excellent with a SimuCube DD1 wheel (very similar to DiRT Rally 1, no filters whatsoever required despite reconstruction 1). So there's no need to go back to the previous version now.

Regarding the price: It's comparably high, especially with additional content, but rally racing is really a niche. As long as the money is used to continue this awesome series, it's fine with me :)

review_title: Very good game that needs a little work
one_reviews_text:
System Specs: 8600K @ 4.8Ghz, 32gb ddr4, 2080 TI, Rift S, Thrusmaster TX

This game is quite beautiful, though I'm a little suprised that I can only run the game on high settings, and not on ultra. Ultra settings introduce a lot of stutter and frame rate dropping :(

The wheel feels decent after tweeking the settings a bit, but seems like they might need a bit of work on the forced feedback side of things, as it can be a little underwhelming right now. The in game settings also seem to be a bit bare bones right now, so hopefully they will patch and fix this stuff in the future. 

The VR spectator screen is displayed as both lenses rather than a full screen view, and I can't seem to find an option to change it in game, which is kinda annoying. There also isnt an option to assign a button on your wheel to 'Reset VR View' which means you have to pause the game, or use the controller to do it.

Overall Id say it's a pretty good game so far, but it could be an amazing game with some performance tweeks and more FFB/wheel settings and customization settings.

Cant get working sound in rift. Meaby there is fix soon cos on bugforums there are others as well.
UPDATE. yeah you can get audio when u disable ALL other soundsources, even its not in use. Then restart game.
Game itself is the best racing game in VR.

review_title: It was good for an arcade game
one_reviews_text:
Perhaps I had unrealistic expectations, but I simply found this title to be good or acceptable for $59.  I have raced a lot of racing titles, both VR and non-VR.  Formula One 2005 to present, iRacing since inception, Nascar when it was called "Hawaii" for online play, the Corse series,  and a Rally game that I can't really remember (but was incredibly fun with just a gamepad).

Perhaps I was just expecting too much, but the steering is vague (I have a Logitech G29) and I had damage turned on but I saw no damage occuring while I was massively wiping out and rolling.  I'm sure I'll be able to get better at the game, but I will stop playing it pretty quickly if the "realism" is what I think it is.  I'm not interested in arcade driving games for $59...

Intel 9900k, NVidia 1080ti, 32 gb RAM, Oculus Rift and Rift S

review_title: This game keep crashing on me
one_reviews_text: Was only able to play 2 trails when I first downloaded this game, however now I can't play the game because it keeps crashing on me. I tried to get a refund after 3 days but that was denied as well.
Where is it?  By the time you release the DLC Dirt Rally 3.0 will be going to Steam.

review_title: Much better performance than Steam VR
one_reviews_text: Oculus version of Dirt 2.0 is really great. I can play it on high details in 80 FPS on Rift S instead of ultra low details on Steam VR version. I hope that Steam version will be fixed soon. My PC is Ryzen 7 3700X , 16 GB RAM (3200 Mhz) and GTX 1080.
No sound, controls working only in menu.

Loved playing the first one?  Well buckle up buttercup because Dirt 2.0 is ready to throw you back into the thick of things.  On a 1080Ti it's an extremelly sound experience and what I've seen so far in terms of mechanics, sound and stages are great.  Best racer and rally experience I've seen in a long time.  Buy with confidence.
it's cool and all but $59.99 for standard version??? anyway.. any DLC available??? come on now, get to it. Ain't no half efforts for $59.99, Codies you are better than this.

The game is fun as long as you race day stages, night stage graphics are all messed up with terrible banding with the Oculus version, Steam version is fine but performance isn't as smooth. I own both.

review_title: Great game but needs work on FFB
one_reviews_text: Having VIVE native support via Steam would be nice as well but over  all this is a great followup to Dirt Rally 1

review_title: Best Rally Sim in a long time
one_reviews_text: Love the game itself, just dissapointed/frustrated that the steam version doesn't support oculus so I had to rebuy the game here.

Very good rally game but there are annoying microsutters, my fps do 90-85fps all the time, it breaks a little bit the pleasure you can have with this game.
Please fix this issue.
Everything Ive been wishing for in a VR racing game
Another must have for all VR racing fans. VR has been improved across the board. Well worth the wait. Thanks codemaster for another quality VR title.

review_title: Thank you for finally bringing to VR
one_reviews_text:
Best rally game finally made it to VR where it belongs.

VR=BUY :)

Thanks.

review_title: Best Racing Game in my Opinion
one_reviews_text: Really great. But I think I must have a Wheel to have the complete experience.
I played a few tracks, just i have no sound?

review_title: Most expensive title and it won't work.
one_reviews_text: Broken.. Will not start. Keeps giving some kind of Exeption error. I cannot find any info on how to correct it. All of the forums deal with the Steam version issues. Uninstalled, reinstalled. Same issue. Most expensive title yet and it does not work.
